name: Taa

sentences: gāã ń káni kã dtsháã
The duck wants the buchu powder
dàã ń |ná̰a kã ǂàã
The polecat looks at the bone
gāã ń kùhm kã ǂgúã
The duck touches the egg
||xàã ń |ná̰a kã ||gà’ã
The men looks at the springbok
||xàã ń ||xûũ kã ǂàã
The men throws the bone
dàã ń kùhm kã ||gà’ã
The polecat touches the springbok
||xàã ń káni kã ǂàã
The men wants the bone
||xà-ã ń káni k-ã ǂgú-ã ||qṵ-ã
The men wants the new egg
||xà-ã ń káni k-e bòkòs-è
The men wants the box
qá-e ń gùm k-e dō’l-e
The woman eats the grass
qá-e ń gùm k-e dàhb-e ||qha-e
The woman eats another mudwasp
gā-ã ń kùhm k-e bòkòs-è !xa-e
The duck touches the big box
||gà’-ã !xa-ã ń kùhm k-e qá-e ||qṵ-e
The big springbok touches the young woman
||xà-ã ||qṵ-ã ń gùm k-e dō’l-e
The young men eats the grass
gā-ã ń káni k-e bòkòs-è ||qha-e
The duck wants another box
èh à gùm k-ã n̄ |-ã ǂà-ã
He ate my bone
n̄ à gùm k-e èh |-e dō’l-e
I ate his grass
gā-ã !xa-ã ń ||xûũ k-e n̄ |-e dàhb-e
The big duck throws my mudwasp
n̄ |-e qá-e à ||xûũ k-ã èh |-ã dtshá-ã ||qṵ-ã
My woman threw his new buchu powder
n̄ à gùm k-ã èh |-ã ǂgú-ã ||qṵ-ã
I ate his new egg
n̄ |-ã gā-ã à gùm k-ã èh |-ã ǂà-ã !xa-ã
My duck ate his big bone
|-é èh ń ||xûũ k-ã dtshá-ã
Does he throw away the buchu powder?
|-ã́ gā-ã ń káni k-e bòkòs-è !xa-e
Does the duck want the big box?
qá-e ń ||qhúa káni k-ã ||gà’-ã !xa-ã t-ã à kùhm k-e dō’l-e ||qṵ-e k-ã
The woman does not want the big springbok that touched the new grass.
èh à gùm k-ã èh |-ã ǂà-ã t-ã dà-ã à |ná̰a k-ã
He ate his bone that the polecat looked at.
n̄ |-ã dà-ã ||qṵ-ã ń ||qhúa dt’kx’àba k-e èh |-e bòkòs-è
My young polecat is not stuck in his box.
n̄ à kùhm k-e dàhb-e t-e ń dt’kx’àba k-ã ǂà-ã k-e
I touched the mudwasp that is stuck to the bone.
|-ã́ dà-ã à káni k-e èh |-e dàhb-e
Did the polecat want his mudwasp?
n̄ à ||qhúa ||xûũ k-e dō’l-e ||qṵ-e t-e qá-e à |ná̰a k-e
I did not throw the new grass that the woman looked at
èh |ã gāã ń káni kã dtsháã
His duck wants the buchu powder.
èh à gùm kã èh |ã ǂàã tã dàã à |ná̰a kã
He ate his bone that the polecat looked at.
n̄ |ã dàã ||qṵã ń dt’kx’àba ke èh |e bòkòsè
My young polecat is stuck in his box.
|ã́ gāã ń ||qhúa káni ke bòkòsè !xae
Does the duck not want the big box?
n̄ à kùhm ke dàhbe te ń dt’kx’àba kã ǂàã ke
I touched the mudwasp that is stuck to the bone.
|é èh ń ||xûũ kã dtsháã
Does he throw away the buchu powder?
|é dàhbe ||qhae à ||qhúa kùhm kã ||xàã |ã ǂgúã
Did another mudwasp not touch the men’s egg?
qáe ń ||qhúa káni kã ||gà’ã !xaã tã à kùhm ke dō’le ||qṵe kã
The woman does not want the big springbok that touched the new grass.
|é n̄ à gùm ke dàhbe ||qṵe te à káni kã ǂgúã ke
Did I eat the young mudwasp that wanted the egg?
|ã́ ||xàã ń ||qhúa gùm kã dtsháã tã n̄ à kùhm kã
Do the men not eat the buchu powder that I touched?
qáe |ã ||gà’ã tã èh ń |ná̰a kã à dt’kx’àba ke dō’le
The woman’s springbok that he looks at was stuck on the grass.
|é n̄ ń ||xûũ kã dàã |ã ǂàã !xaã tã ń ||qhúa dt’kx’àba ke n̄ |e bòkòsè ||qṵe kã
Do I throw away the polecat’s big bone that is not stuck to my new box?
|é qáe ||qṵe te n̄ à |ná̰a ke ń gùm kã dtsháã ||qṵã
Does the young woman that I looked at eat the new buchu powder?
èh à ||qhúa káni kã ǂgúã ||qhaã tã ||xàã à kùhm kã
He did not want another egg that the men touched.
|ã́ ||gà’ã ||qhaã tã ń ||qhúa kùhm kã dàã kã à ||xûũ kã gāã |ã ǂgúã
Did another springbok that doesn’t touch the polecat throw away the duck’s egg?

note: The language is spoken by around 2,500 people in Botswana and Namibia. It includes a wide variety of click consonants (like the sound of tskor tut in English), marked by the letters !, |, ||, ǂ, and ’. ã, aã, a̰a, ae, ua, ṵã, ṵe,and uũ are vowels, and the symbols ◌́, ◌̀, ◌̂, and ◌̄ mark tone.
